results.title: Democracy in action: citizen's welfare, citizen's job
results.creator_credit: H Schiller, O.E. Kress and Ifage Filmproduktion (DE)
results.brief_description: A close look at the manifold tasks of the elected shire and town councillors in Germany. We see them at meetings, seeking progress and prosperity for their citizens. By encouraging and helping establish new local industries on a community basis, there is resultant increase in population, housing, hospitals, and amenities. Such progress is soundly based and assured.
results.title_for_label: Democracy in action: citizen’s welfare, citizen’s job

results.title: Democracy forged in a gun barrel
results.brief_description: A unique perspective on the Eureka Stockade story created by a Eureka 150 youth ambassador in a special Digital Storytelling Workshop to celebrate 150 years since the famous rebellion. “Eureka to me is true Australian grit and courage. It’s about people standing up against injustice and believing in a cause greater than themselves”.

results.title: Democracy a la Maude
results.creator_credit: Patricia Kearns, Signe Johansson, Annette Clarke and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Profiles social critic and outspoken head of Canada’s largest citizens rights group, the Council of Canadians, Maude Barlow. Through interviews with family members and Barlow herself, we hear how her fighting spirit emerged from an early age, her introduction to feminism in the 1970s as a young mother, and her involvement in women’s affairs, including areas such as media pornography, equality and reform for the living conditions of women prisoners. Most noticeably, Barlow spearheaded the Council of Canadian’s court challenge against the Competition Bureau and Hollinger Inc after the Canadian government supported media magnate Conrad Black’s takeover of Southam Newspapers - without public debate. The decision would give Barlow’s company control over more than half of Canada’s daily newspapers. Includes footage from various speeches and forums Barlow has taken part in, including “The Free trade debate”. She also shares her views on corporate rule and globalisation.

results.title: Democracy
results.creator_credit: Harold Lasswell and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: This is a companion film for use with the film “Despotism”. It gives a short abstract treatment of the meaning of the word, “democracy”, showing that two of the historical conditions essential for the existence of democracy are a balanced economic distribution and an enlightened population, which in turn produce two of the abstract characteristics of democracy - shared respect and shared power.

results.title: Democracy
results.brief_description: This program documents the minute details of the “little” man’s campaign for Federal Election. Peter McIlwaine, the local chemist, stands for the marginal NSW Liberal-held seat of Cook. We see him with the branch’s hard-working party faithfuls struggling with limited resources, and we see him in awkward meetings with his leaders.

results.title: Demetrius and the gladiators
results.creator_credit: Delmer Daves, Frank Ross and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description: This is the successful sequel to “The Robe” and the evil Roman Emperor, Caligula is searching for the robe Christ wore in the belief that this will give him eternal life. Demetrius, a Greek slave is sentenced to train as a gladiator and falls under the spell of the beautifully sensuous Messalina and renounces his Christian beliefs. Full of action as gladiators fight wild beasts and each other, this film is an entertaining example of the toga movie. Starring Victor Mature, Susan Hayward, Jay Robinson, Michael Rennie, Debra Paget, Anne Bancroft and Richard Egan.

results.title: Dementia 13
results.creator_credit: Francis Ford Coppola, Roger Corman and American International Pictures (AIP)
results.brief_description: This gory shlock-horror film (Coppola’s first commercial feature) follows the plight of a greedy woman, Louise Haloran (Luana Anders), whose husband dies of a heart attack. Ms Haloran’s plan is to pretend her husband is still alive to keep the fortune he’s soon to inherit from his crazed, dying mother (Ethne Dunn). What follows is a series of bizarre and grisly murders. Written and directed by Coppola and made with a budget of a mere $22,000.

results.title: Deliverance (Special edition) (D)
results.creator_credit: John Boorman, Elmer Enterprises and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: The story of four ordinary men who embark on a canoe trip in the backwoods of America, determined to test themselves against a wilderness they only think they understand. Jon Voight, Burt Reynolds, Ned Beatty and Ronny Cox play the four friends whose three-dimensional roles heighten the film’s impact and broader significance. Director John Boorman, renowned for his mastery of visual beauty and compelling mystery, maintains a narrative tension that never falters. The film is like a phantom; its images linger in our minds long after the river slows and returns us to real life. Screenplay by James Dickey, based upon his novel. This special edition contains a behind the scenes documentary, “The Dangerous world of ‘Deliverance’” and the original theatrical trailer, both of which appear before the feature.
